name: Boston Financial District - Location and charm
description: Great spot right in the Financial District. 2 Blocks from South Station. You can't beat this location - convenient to everything downtown. Cool loft in an historic building from the early 1900's, a former shoe factory. In the '80's, the neighborhood was converted into studios by artists. This loft was built out by a painter/photographer. It still has its artistic roots, with the guest room itself being the original dark room converted to a bedroom. Unique! This is one of the best locations in Boston. It is right downtown two blocks from South Station. It can't be beat. The loft has 13 foot ceilings, skylights and windows allowing for tons of sunlight, a wonderful roof deck with downtown views, and the original artistic layout makes for a very unique feel. name: Rare, Spacious Loft in the Heart of Downtown
description: You don't get any closer to the heart of downtown Boston than this spot. And you also don't get such a spacious loft - fantastic for entertainment space - with this rate! Within a 15-minute walk, you'll arrive at all the major Boston neighborhoods - Back Bay, Seaport, North End, Downtown Crossing and more! You're next to the top nightclubs, across from South Station Amtrak Terminal, surrounded by comedy clubs and restaurants. In short, there's so much energy here and so much loft to enjoy! This is an 1800 square foot loft with industrial character. The building used to be a leather factory in the early 1900s and you can see its charm with stainless steel doors throughout, exposed central HVAC ductwork, and an indoor garage door! The beautiful open layout lets the kitchen, living room, and overall space flow seamlessly throughout.
